intro: Mattuschkia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Mattuschkia is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its bloom period typically occurs in late summer, adding vibrant color to desert landscapes.
